In reply to your letter of the 30th March, received by me on the 3rd of April,
Letter not found. The minutes record (pp. 178-9) that M reported receipt of the letter from the Brunswick Borough Council at a meeting of the Trustees of Royal Park held on 6 April 1871. The Council sought the Trustees' sanction of an extension of its cricket ground in Royal Park, 'in reference to which the Council had some correspondence with the Board of Land and Works'. I have the honor to inform you that I have been instructed by the Trustees of the Royal Park at a meeting held on the 6th inst, to request you to furnish the Trustees with a copy of the Letter from the Department of Land & Works to which you allude, in order that such communication may be placed before the trustees for their consideration at their next meeting.
